content:
After a battle with wrap-span">Harper Lee’s wrap-span">estate, a new wrap-span">interpretation of the novel has opened on wrap-span">Broadway

wrap-span">ADAPTATIONS of “To Kill a Mockingbird”, wrap-span">Harper Lee’s wrap-span">Pulitzer prize-winning novel of race, wrap-span">prejudice and wrap-span">bravery in the American south, are rare. There was a film in 1962, starring wrap-span">Gregory wrap-span">Peck; Monroeville, Alabama, Lee’s hometown and the supposed setting for the book, runs a production in the wrap-span">courthouse each May. Both of these wrap-span">interpretations stay largely true to the original text, and are popular as a result. The film won wrap-span">Horton wrap-span">Foote a Best Adapted wrap-span">Screenplay Oscar. Monroeville’s plays, allowing “wrap-span">attendees an opportunity to transport themselves back to the time of the book’s setting”, sell out.

A new wrap-span">Broadway production, written by wrap-span">Aaron Sorkin (“The West Wing”, “The Social Network”, “A Few Good Men”), has proved more wrap-span">controversial. In 2016, weeks before her death, Lee gave her wrap-span">approval for it to go ahead even though “ she wrap-span">abhors anything that trades on the book’s fame ”. In March this year her wrap-span">estate sued the producers on the grounds that the wrap-span">script was a “wrap-span">fundamental rethink” of the story. They pointed to the larger role of Calpurnia (LaTanya Richardson Jackson), the Finches’ wrap-span">maid, changes to the character of Atticus (Jeff Daniels) and an interview with Mr Sorkin in which he claimed to be offering a “different take” on the tale so well-known from classrooms. A month later, the production countersued, offering to perform the show in a New York court. The case was settled before opening night.

It is true that Mr Sorkin wrap-span">diverges from Lee’s novel in wrap-span">noticeable ways, and is less wrap-span">reverent of the original text (“I wasn’t going to wrap-span">swaddle the book in wrap-span">bubble wrap and transfer it gently to a stage,” he has said ). Plenty is left on the cutting-room floor: although wrap-span">narrated by her, events are not wrap-span">wholly filtered through Scout’s wrap-span">childlike, wrap-span">unreliable wrap-span">perspective; many of the secondary and wrap-span">tertiary Maycomb characters have been lost, including members of the Finch family; there is no wrap-span">jury in the wrap-span">courtroom scenes; the important Boo Radley wrap-span">subplot gets less focus. Many of these changes are probably wrap-span">logistical wrap-span">sacrifices, made to keep the running time to two-and-a-half hours. 

The most significant edits are to characterisation, and they are not always an improvement. In many cases the good are made better and the bad, worse. Bob wrap-span">Ewell’s abuse of his daughter Mayella is not simply wrap-span">alluded to, but laid bare for the audience to see. Rather than deducing Dill’s mother’s flaws through his stories, they are wrap-span">demonstrated in a new scene. This robs figures of their wrap-span">complexity.

Whether the production does that to Calpurnia and Atticus is wrap-span">questionable. Among the terms of the settlement, according to Mr Sorkin, were that Atticus’s new drinking habit would be wrap-span">excised, along with the shotgun secreted in his closet and wrap-span">exclamations of “wrap-span">goddammit”. The production kept his wrap-span">harsher moments in the wrap-span">script—including an wrap-span">outburst of violence—and Calpurnia’s larger role. Mr Sorkin stages scenes between the two characters, which touch on wrap-span">masculinity and the memory of the civil war, and wrap-span">acknowledge the power wrap-span">dynamics in their relationship. The dialogue could easily feel wrap-span">anachronistic, but it is wrap-span">deftly handled.

Still, Calpurnia’s character is not expanded beyond the limits of her service to the Finches. When she is not talking alone with Atticus, she is reduced to simply chiming in from across the room. Ms Richardson Jackson offers a compelling performance, but her character feels always at risk of devolving into wrap-span">stereotype.

Atticus, meanwhile, is not the idealised figure he once was. Mr Sorkin works hard to emphasise the wrap-span">contemporary wrap-span">relevance of the story, and the question of how far communities should wrap-span">tolerate those who refuse to wrap-span">tolerate others. Where Atticus’s willingness to search for the good in others is his great strength in the book, it is presented as a flaw and a weakness in the play. It seems to be a nod to the wrap-span">racist version of Atticus as written in “Go Set a Watchman”, though Mr Sorkin has said that he has not read the book, published in 2015. He was inspired instead by President Donald Trump’s wrap-span">mealy-mouthed comments about white wrap-span">supremacists in wrap-span">Charlottesville, Virginia.

The writing can on wrap-span">occasion be wrap-span">distracting. Mr Sorkin has a weakness for wrap-span">didactic speeches and seems to have developed a habit of repeating wrap-span">variations of those if he is particularly proud of (this wrap-span">reviewer noticed two that had echoes of scenes in “The West Wing”). But at its best, it is in harmony with Lee’s. The moments between Atticus and his children have a feeling of warmth and respect that readers will wrap-span">delight in recognising from the book, matched with Mr Sorkin’s wrap-span">signature fast-paced, precise dialogue.

If some of the creative choices do not always pay off, this new wrap-span">adaptation of “To Kill a Mockingbird” is still to be applauded. Simply transferring this beloved tale from page to stage is one thing; attempting to wrap-span">meld two wrap-span">narrative and writing styles is a much wrap-span">bolder endeavour. Incorporating the novel’s post-publication history is a wrap-span">shrewd move. It asks wrap-span">provocative questions of its American audience, and is a reminder of why Lee’s work deserves to be returned to time and again.

最后，拉较低的角落，直至塔克下婴儿的下巴完成一个安全的襁褓。

ex: n. 第三纪；第三修道会会员；第三级教士
adj. 第三的；第三位的；三代的

主位图和副位图较为常见，但是很少有包含第三个位图的消息。

ex: vt. 忍受；默许；宽恕

你怎么能忍受这个？

我们必须知道如何忍受那些与我们不同的人”。
They gain understanding of what they need in a mate, and what they cannot , making them more careful about choosing the second time around.
他们已懂得自己需要从配偶身上得到什么，以及不能忍受什么，从而在选择第二段婚姻时会更加小心谨慎。

ex: adj. 不可靠的；靠不住的

wp.unreliable narrator: 不可靠的叙述者;不可靠叙述者;不可靠的叙事者;不可信的叙述者

eg2: That’s twice what the unreliable rumor says.
这是那些不可靠的流言所说的两倍。
They are two of a kind and totally .
他俩是同类货色， 都是不可靠的人。
If they sided with their Muslim friends, they were regarded as . In spite of their Muslim faith, they were after all Chinese!
如果他们站在穆斯林朋友一边，会被认为不可靠，因为尽管他们有穆斯林信仰，他们仍然是汉人。

ex: n. 变异；变体；变奏；变种
网络 变化；变奏曲；变动
eg2: The dial records very slight variations in pressure.
该刻度盘能显示很微小的压力变化。
Currency exchange rates are always subject to variation.
货币的兑换率总在波动。
regional/seasonal variation(= depending on the region or time of year)
地区性╱季节性变化
This soup is a spicy variation on a traditional favourite.
这种汤是在一种受欢迎的传统汤羹中加了香料。
a set of variations on a theme by Mozart
以莫扎特某一乐曲为主题的一组变奏曲
His numerous complaints are all variations on a theme(= all about the same thing) .
他的满腹牢骚说来道去都是为了一件事。

ex: adv. 完全地；全部；统统
eg2: They contract work out .
他们把工作全部包了出去。
None of us can be absolved  of wrong doing.
我们当中没有一个人的罪行能完全获得赦免。
He reaffirmed that he was  responsible for the confusion.
他再次表明对此混乱情况他负有全部责任。

ex: v. 包；用…包裹（或包扎、覆盖等）；用…缠绕（或围紧）；（使文字）换行
n. 围巾；包裹（或包装）材料；停机
网络 外套；卷；披肩

他花了一个晚上的时间把圣诞礼物都包了起来。
individually wrapped chocolates
单块包装的巧克力
Wrap the meat in foil before you cook it.
把肉用锡箔裹起来后再烹调。
I wrapped the baby (up) in a blanket.
我用毯子把婴儿裹了起来。
I wrapped a blanket around the baby.
我用毯子把婴儿裹了起来。
A scarf was wrapped around his neck.
他的脖子上围着一条围巾。
His arms were wrapped around her waist.
他的双臂紧紧环抱她的腰。
How can I wrap the text around?
我怎么才能使文本换行呢？
The text wraps around if it is too long to fit the screen.
如果文本太长，在显示屏放不下的话，会自动换行。
We stock a wide range of cards and gift wrap .
我们备有各种各样的贺卡和礼品包装材料。
Cut! That's a wrap.
停！就拍摄到这儿。
Next year's collection is still being kept under wraps.
明年的时装系列仍在保密之中。
